climbs.name: Ruffian
climbs.fa: Jim Scott, Dean Brault, Peter Noebels

content.description: Great climbing up a shallow left-facing dihedral on the lower face, a ledgy middle, and an exciting crux pull over the upper roof on some hollow-sounding but well-wedged blocks. Although the climbing isn't hard for the grade, this one feels a bit spicy and requires a good head. There is still some loose rock on the ledge and near the roof, so be aware of what you're pulling on!
content.protection: Single set of Cams and stoppers through #2 camalot, clip-and-lower anchors.
content.location: The right-hand crack on the wall.

content.description: Cool face climbing to ledge.  A little grungy off the ledge with a tricky finish.
content.location: Face right of the other two routes.

content.description: Crank up pumpy sidepulls and edges on the clean lower face, scramble over the ledgy middle section, and jam out the burly roof crack on assorted handjams, fingerlocks, and edges. A great but devious route requiring a fine combination of power and body english.
content.protection: 2 bolts, #.3-#2 camalots, couple medium stoppers, clip-and-lower anchors.
content.location: The left-hand roof crack on the wall, with two bolts on the lower face.

content.description: A compact buttress with a clean lower face, a ledged-out middle section, and an upper roof split by two cracks. These lines are great trad additions to the canyon for those few who bring a rack out here.
